column6: Occupation health and safety management system
column7: The Lottery Corporation implemented the Workplace Health, Safety and Wellbeing Policy.

column6: Occupation health and safety management system
column13: The Lottery Corporation has implemented a health, safety, and well-being framework. This framework includes policies, procedures, reporting, training, and education that prioritize the health and safety of our people.
column20: Health, safety, and wellbeing framework, Workplace safety, Employee health and safety

column6: Hazard identification, risk assessment, and incident investigation
column13: The Lottery Corporation's employees work in various environments, including offices, warehouses, and contact centres. Some staff members travel regularly to connect with our retail partners. Providing a safe work environment for our employees is a priority for The Lottery Corporation.\t
column20: Workplace safety, Employee safety, Safe work environment

column6: Occupational health services
column13: To help reduce the likelihood of physical injuries occurring in the workplace, The Lottery Corporation conduct periodic safety and hazard reviews in each of our sites and seeks to remediate any issues identified promptly; provide periodic training to employees to enhance health and safety awareness; conduct audits on specific hazards and risks across our sites; encourage an environment of reporting; and promote safety consultation.\t
column20: Physical injuries prevention, Safety and hazard reviews, Health and safety awareness

column6: Worker participation, consultation, and communication on occupational health and safety
column13: The People & Remuneration Committee has a health, safety, and well-being standing agenda item at each meeting, where they are presented with health, safety, and well-being performance and any critical issues that may have arisen or may arise.
column20: People & Remuneration Committee, Meeting agenda, Performance monitoring

column6: Worker training on occupational health and safety
column13: The Lottery Corporation also acknowledged the importance of mental health and, in FY23, providing mental health first-aid training to 32 of our people leaders to help them recognize and respond to signs of mental health issues that may arise in their teams.
column20: Mental health first-aid training, Employee support, Employee wellbeing

column6: Promotion of worker health
column13: The Lottery Corporation provides an Employee Assistance Program with a holistic health and well-being approach. The program includes mental health support, emergency counselling, team member and leader coaching, financial coaching, legal referrals, and more.
column20: Employee Assistance Program, Health and wellbeing, Mental health support

column13: The Lottery Corporation has staff dedicated to customer care and trained in responsible play. The Lottery Corporation Contact Centre is committed to responsible play. The Lottery Corporation's staff are trained as Responsible Play Liaison Officers with structured training.

column13: The Lottery Corporation also has various policies and programs to help employees feel safe and included. These consist of a Gender Affirmation Statement of Support, which outlines the different programs that The Lottery Corporation offers to its employees, such as paid leave for gender affirmation-related activities, financial allowance to support the gender affirmation process and allowing employees to help a member of their household who is undertaking a gender affirmation process.
column20: Gender Affirmation Statement of Support, Employee support programs, Inclusion programs

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: In FY23, The Lottery Corporation established gender diversity targets (40:40:20) for our Board and Senior Leader level to achieve by 2025. As of 30 June 2023, women represent 37% of our Senior Leaders and 42% of our Board.
column20: Gender diversity, Board representation, Diversity initiatives

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: To support the representation of women at the Senior Leader level, The Lottery Corporation has implemented a Lotteries Women in Leadership Program. This program helps women prepare for top leadership positions.

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees

column6: Ratio of basic salary and remuneration of women to men
column13: The Lottery Corporation has also conducted a Gender Equity Pay Gap review in FY23. On a like-for-like role basis, the differential between amounts paid to male employees and female employees was 1% (higher to males). The Lottery Corporation is working to reduce this gap and intends to perform gender pay gap reviews on an annual basis.

column13: During FY23, The Lottery Corporation delivered modern slavery training to all our Procurement, Legal, and Risk team members. The Lottery Corporation's slavery training raises awareness around modern slavery and our responsibilities as a business and helps our people identify modern slavery risks and concerns. In FY24, this training will be made available to all staff.

column13: The Lottery Corporation is committed to making a meaningful difference to Australian communities. In partnership with the 50-50 Foundation, an Australian Charities and Not-for-profits Commission (ACNC) registered charity, we are very proud to have helped raise more than $2.7m by conducting 181 charitable game draws and awarding more than $2.3m in prizes in FY23 for a wide range of not-for-profit organizations and grassroots sporting clubs.
